Comment: I've lived around Silicon  Valley over 28 years, all in high tech- start ups, large corps, SaaS, etc.  great years/ shitty years.   Very few real leaders exist in tech companies- most of the top tech execs. VCs are truly awful peoole with bankrupt soulswho do not care about the human race other than their own tribe of billionaires.   It's interesting to see the reactions from mainstream society -US and beyond to get their first taste of these grotesque pigs.   Money- in and of itself- was never super interesting to me, maybe because I come from several generations of privilege.   I would honestly be perplexed about what to do with $1b or anything over 100m... Honestly like WTF would you do with that?   Not so Googly anymore now is it?  Veil is off

Comment: An explanation I've given for how DOGE works is that its a similar method to how silicon valley programmers work, removing things to see what breaks.   I dont know how prevelant that is but as a non-silicon valley programmer, the context missing is that programmers (or at least, good programmers) have things like error handling, unit tests, version control, etc so if you were going to remove or change something, you can test to see the specific impact and rollback to a stable state if it does break something.   Removing or changing something without having those systems is something which should be done with the utmost caution. Its (yet another) sign of Elons technical inexperience that he did it anyway and with glee.
Author: Scaphism92
